item.title: Some PHP help
item.dc:creator: @VorargC VorargC
item.description:
@VorargC wrote:

  mysql_connect($dbhost, $dbuser, $dbpass) or die(mysql_error());
  mysql_select_db($dbname) or die(mysql_error());
 
$q = "SELECT valid FROM ".TBL_USERS." WHERE username LIKE '".$user."'";
      $result = mysql_query($q);
      $row = mysql_fetch_array($result);
      $valid = $row['valid'];
         
                 if($valid == 0 && $session->logged_in){
         $field = 'user';
           echo '<li><a class="btn-danger" href="proccess.php">VALIDATE ACCOUNT</a></li>';
   } else if($valid == 1 && $session->logged_in)  {
          echo 'Account Validated';
   }

Change it to that, so we know there aren’t any conflicts with the result.

Read full topic

item.title: Some PHP help
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

im gonna try something different which will give me another error so gimme 2 minutes

EDIT:

$q = "SELECT valid FROM ".TBL_USERS." WHERE username='$user'" or die(mysql_error());
      $valid = $database->query($q);
      $valid = mysql_fetch_array($valid);
      $valid = $valid['valid'];
          
                 if($valid == 0 && $session->logged_in){
         $field = 'user';
           echo '<li><a class="btn-danger" href="proccess.php">VALIDATE ACCOUNT</a></li>';
   } else if($valid == 1 && $session->logged_in)  {
          echo 'Account Validated';
   }

Thats what I have and literally no error. hastingsunlimited.net

Register and look at the navbar

item.title: Some PHP help

In your query method you should probably add or die(mysql_error()), to find syntax errors.

In your query method you should probably add or die(mysql_error()), to find syntax errors.

item.title: Some PHP help
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:4, topic:483798”][quote author=silabgarza link=topic=602033.msg4220141#msg4220141 date=1360691753]

what’s up with TBL_USERS?

try this instead

edit: rewrote some parts for you

[code]<?php
mysql_connect($dbhost, $dbuser, $dbpass) or die(mysql_error());
mysql_select_db($dbname) or die(mysql_error());

$result = mysql_query(“SELECT valid FROM “.TBL_USERS.” WHERE username=’$user’”);
$details = mysql_fetch_array($result);
$valid = $details[‘valid’];

if($valid == 0 && $session->logged_in){
$field = ‘user’;
echo ‘

  • VALIDATE ACCOUNT
    • ’;
    } else if($valid == 1 && $session->logged_in) {
    echo ‘Account Validated’;
    }
    ?>[/code]
    [/quote]
    He will have TBL_USERS defined as a constant in a config file:P I’ll help you with this when I get home from work, Brian. It’s hard to do shit on an iPad lol.[/quote]
    lol alright.

    that constant is located in constants.php. I have a file that will validate them but I dont want the users to go to a different page to get validated, I’d rather them do it from the navbar. which is why im doing this

    Read full topic

edit: rewrote some parts for you

mysql_select_db($dbname) or die(mysql_error());

$result = mysql_query(“SELECT valid FROM “.TBL_USERS.” WHERE username=’$user’”);
$details = mysql_fetch_array($result);
$valid = $details[‘valid’];

if($valid == 0 && $session->logged_in){
$field = ‘user’;
echo ‘

  • VALIDATE ACCOUNT
    • ’;
    } else if($valid == 1 && $session->logged_in) {
    echo ‘Account Validated’;
    }

item.title: Some PHP help
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:


what's up with TBL_USERS?

try this instead
[code]$q = "SELECT valid FROM TBL_USERS WHERE username='$user'";[/code]


edit: rewrote some parts for you

[code]<?php
 mysql_connect($dbhost, $dbuser, $dbpass) or die(mysql_error());
 mysql_select_db($dbname) or die(mysql_error());

 $result = mysql_query("SELECT valid FROM ".TBL_USERS." WHERE username='$user'");
 $details = mysql_fetch_array($result);
 $valid = $details['valid'];

 if($valid == 0 && $session->logged_in){
  $field = 'user';
  echo '<li><a class="btn-danger" href="proccess.php">VALIDATE ACCOUNT</a></li>';
 } else if($valid == 1 && $session->logged_in)  {
  echo 'Account Validated';
 }
?>[/code]

what’s up with TBL_USERS?

try this instead

edit: rewrote some parts for you

[code]<?php
mysql_connect($dbhost, $dbuser, $dbpass) or die(mysql_error());
mysql_select_db($dbname) or die(mysql_error());

$result = mysql_query(“SELECT valid FROM “.TBL_USERS.” WHERE username=’$user’”);
$details = mysql_fetch_array($result);
$valid = $details[‘valid’];

if($valid == 0 && $session->logged_in){
$field = ‘user’;
echo ‘

  • VALIDATE ACCOUNT
    • ’;
    } else if($valid == 1 && $session->logged_in) {
    echo ‘Account Validated’;
    }
    ?>[/code]

    Read full topic

item.title: Some PHP help
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

<?php

 
  mysql_connect($dbhost, $dbuser, $dbpass) or die(mysql_error());
  mysql_select_db($dbname) or die(mysql_error());
  
$q = "SELECT valid FROM ".TBL_USERS." WHERE username='$user'";
      $valid = $database->query($q);
      $valid = mysql_fetch_array($valid);
      $valid = $valid['valid'];
	  
		 if($valid == 0 && $session->logged_in){
         $field = 'user';
	   echo '<li><a class="btn-danger" href="proccess.php">VALIDATE ACCOUNT</a></li>';
   } else if($valid == 1 && $session->logged_in)  {
	  echo 'Account Validated';
   }
?>

This only displays “Activate account” even to a person whose account is already activated. Anyone see the error?

Read full topic
